meanings.definition: To send off or away with promptness or speed.
meanings.sent1: The mail carrier was dispatching letters to different houses in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The manager dispatched the urgent order to the warehouse for immediate processing.
meanings.sent3: The superhero was dispatching evil villains left and right with incredible speed.
meanings.sent4: The skilled chef was dispatching orders in the kitchen like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The emergency team was dispatching medical supplies to the disaster area without delay.

meanings.sent1: The executioner was dispatching the criminal according to the court's order.
meanings.sent2: The lethal injection dispatched the condemned prisoner swiftly and painlessly.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about dispatching his alarm clock every morning for waking him up early.
meanings.sent4: The grim reaper was dispatching souls to the afterlife with his scythe.
meanings.sent5: The deadly virus was dispatching its victims with alarming speed.

meanings.definition: To transact or dispose of (a matter) promptly or speedily.
meanings.sent1: The efficient secretary was dispatching paperwork to clear the office backlog.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer dispatched the legal documents to finalize the contract quickly.
meanings.sent3: The magician was dispatching his tricks with such speed that the audience couldn't keep up.
meanings.sent4: The auctioneer was dispatching bids in a rapid-fire manner to keep the auction moving.
meanings.sent5: The team was dispatching tasks to each member to complete the project on time.
